about.summary: The systemPipeShiny (SPS) framework comes with many useful utility functions. However, installing the whole framework is heavy and takes some time. If you like only a few useful utility functions from SPS, install this package is enough.

The systemPipeShiny (SPS) framework comes with many useful utility functions. However, installing the whole framework is heavy and takes some time. If you like only a few useful utility functions from SPS, install this package is enough.

name: r-spsutil
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.2.2.1" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-spsutil
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/spsUtil_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/spsUtil/spsUtil_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1247f628571c046805c9b0e4acf4bd5c25fa8312974085483c1422a5e46a7b8a

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

# Suggests: testthat
requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-crayon
    - r-glue
    - r-httr
    - r-magrittr
    - r-stringr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-assertthat
    - r-crayon
    - r-glue
    - r-httr
    - r-magrittr
    - r-stringr

test:
  commands:
    # You can put additional test commands to be run here.
    - $R -e "library('spsUtil')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('spsUtil')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/lz100/spsUtil
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: The systemPipeShiny (SPS) framework comes with many useful utility functions. However, installing the whole framework is heavy and takes some time. If you like only a few useful utility functions from SPS, install this package is enough.

  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3


extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

#original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Date: 2021-05-04
